intro: Iozoste leiantha, commonly known as the silverleaf daphne, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its silvery-gray foliage and clusters of fragrant, pinkish-white flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub, reaching heights of up to 1.5 meters. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Iozoste leiantha is valued for its ornamental appeal and is often cultivated in gardens for its aesthetic and aromatic qualities.
